div.l: And eke also for she was somdele smotirlich
She was as dyne as watir r yn a dich
And ful of hocour as a pismare
Here þouȝte a lady sholde hir spare
What for hir kynrede and hir nortilrie
Þat she hadde lernyd in þe Nonrie
A douȝtir hadde þey betwix ham two
Of xxᵗⁱ yeer withoute ony mo
Savynge a child þat was of half yeer age
In cradil it lay and was a proꝑper page
This wenche þicke and wel I growe was
With Camois nose and yen grey as glas
Buttokkis brode ⁊and brestis rounde ⁊and hy
But riȝt fair was her heer I wil not ly
The parson of þe toun for she was feyr
In purpos was to make hir his heir
Bothe of his catell and of his mesuage
And straunge he made it of hir mariage
His purpos was to bestowe here hie
Vnto sum worthi blood of auncetrie
For holi chirche godes moste be spendid
Of holi chirche blood þat is descendid
Therefore he wolde his holi blood honoure
Thouȝ þat holi chirche sholde deuoure
Gret sokyn hadde þis myller out of doute
With whete ⁊and malt of al þe lond aboute
And nameli þer was A gret Colege
Men clepith it þe scoler halle of Cambregge
There was her whete and ek hir͗e malt I grounde
And on aday it happed in a stounde
Seek lay þe Mauncipil on amalady
Men wenden wisly that he sholde dy
Fro whom this myller stale bothe whete ⁊and corn̄
An hundrid tyme more þan he did beforn̄
For þere before he staal but curteisly
But now he was a theef ful outragesly
For whiche þe wardeyn chidde ⁊and made fare
But therof set þis Millere not a tare
